intro: Ecbolium lorentzianum, commonly known as the Lorentzian sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, succulent structure with fleshy, spiny stems and leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, often appearing in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low precipitation. Due to its unique morphology and ecological niche, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
